replies.body: For the streamig websites I'd recommend Kissanime and Crunchyroll. For the anime I'd recommend that you would watch some "easy to watch" anime to understand it (Note: This is not a must, it might just help you out in the beginning, it helped me out at least). For that I'd recommend Sword Art Online, Fairy Tail, Black Butler or Fullmetal alchemist. After you've gotten into anime you should start watching more complicated ones like Mekakucity actors or No Game No Life.

replies.body: I vouch for Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood, why? It has a great storyline and each episode actually builds on the story whereas in other animes, most of it is filler episodes. This anime brings up pretty much every part of human emotion possible. The pace throughout the anime is good, the story is not rushed, nor long, 64 episodes is a nice number of episodes. All of the characters are developed throughout the series which is great as well. One of the best animes ever, I would rate it a 10 out of 10!
replies.body_tagged: I vouch for Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood, why? It has a great storyline and each episode actually builds on the story whereas in other animes, most of it is filler episodes. This anime brings up pretty much every part of human emotion possible. The pace throughout the anime is good, the story is not rushed, nor long, 64 episodes is a nice number of episodes. All of the characters are developed throughout the series which is great as well. One of the best animes ever, I would rate it a 10 out of 10!

replies.body:
lol I watched so much anime yesterday :P

Sword Art Online Season ll Episode 5
I loved how Sinon learned that Kirito was actually a guy. They arent friends anymore, but I think they will be in later episodes because their friendship only lasted a day. And as shown in the intro, Sinon is a pretty big character in the whole plot. She might appear later.

Angel Beats!
Basically, I watched the whole series yesterday. It makes sense since there are only 13 episodes. That's what I thought the problem was. The whole story was mushed into just 13 episodes. The anime really never explained how everyone died; only Yuri, Iwasawa, Otanashi, and we can assume how Yui died. What I would love is if they made some sort of movie that explained how each member of the Battlefront died.

Alright, so I'm not the type of person that cries a lot. In fact, I haven't cried in years. But when I saw the end of Angel Beats!, I just had to. The whole thing had just touched me, thinking that all of them were just people who weren't able to accomplish something in their real life and died with regrets. The part that made me cry was the graduation part. I did have a sad feeling when Iwasawa and Yui both passed on. And I felt soooo bad when Kanade left Otanashi. Thats the part that totally ripped me apart. Otanashi's heart was donated to Kanade! It made me feel so sad that when Kanade left because her whole purpose in that world was to thank Otanashi. When she did leave, Otanashi screamed out because she left.

I heard Clannad was sadder, so I know it will be good. Now I have something to look forward to.

Death Note Episode 1
I had a first bad impression on this anime, mostly on the intro. I just thought it was freaking creepy. I did like the idea of the story though.

I stopped watching it because the story isn't interesting enough, it doesn't really have twists to keep you interested.

Bleach is the same except more Badass and dark. I was really sad it was temp cancelled for the manga to get ahead and it's been canceled for like a year now. Still waiting. Plz make manga faster.

replies.body:
Wanna bring this back up because i am gonna give my ratings over the completed anime series i watched over 2014 :3

=!=!=!=SPOILERS AHEAD=!=!=!=   
=!=!=!=SPOILERS AHEAD=!=!=!= 


You have been warned



Sword Art Online: 7/10 - Let me just say that it was a good anime. I t had potential with a suckish plot. I mean, when i read the sypnosis, i was like  "wow i wanna watch this" but i didnt like it towards the end due to ALO and the plot is going all over the place. First its about Kirito, then Asuna, and now Yukki? I thought Asuna was cool. I wanted her to be that typical tsudere girl but she broke character which i don like :(. Shes so girly now and ya. I would give this a 8.7/10 if 

They used the 50 episodes to actually go more indepth in the Aincrad Saga, skip AlO, add GGO and Sinion, Sinion dates Kirito, and then ALO with out Yukki in the end. Like i thought it was pretty unneccsary. (Btw, i did not have any feels in the last episode when Yukki died becuz i was pretty mad when Yukki was the best swordsman) So ya, could have been better.

#KiritoxSinon

Akame Ga Kill: 7.8/10- Again, this anime had potential. I would have rated it 9/10 but when the anime did not correspond with the manga and everyone started dieing, i was like -_-. seriously?!?!?! Well, i gave it a .8 because the plot was outstanding, battle was epic and the last fight with Akame vs Esdeth was pretty sweet.

Amagi Brilliant Park: 8/10- This anime is actually not bad. I mean its good to relax after you watched a big anime series. It was pretty funny with jokes here and there. One thing i didnt like in particular was Kaine and Sento. Like I wanted a bit of romance in the series which there was but it didnt feel complete. If this actually went to be a romance, i would have rated it a 9/10. Pretty good anime so i recommend but the ending is sort of, lacklustering or anti climatic

The Pet Girl at Sakaurasou: 9.2/10- This anime, a funny comedic, slice of life with romance was really good and I totally recommend this to everybody. It starts off where this one normal guy lives in a special dorm for kids who have talented abilities but most are crazy. Things changed when a girl named Mashorin appeard. A talented artist, things began to change at Sakurasou. This anime kept me hooked with all the jokes and the plot is amazing. I cried a little at the end when Mashorin showed her painting and ya, just watch it, i had some feels towards the end ;)

Recommend for 2015:

Absoulute Duo
How to raise a boring girlfriend
Durarara S1 and S2
Nisekoi S1 and S2(coming april)
Daily Life of High School Boys
Clannad and Clannad After Story (please watch both in order for your feels meter to be over 9000. its worth)
Yona of the Dawn

Animes i personaly recommend:

Baka to Test S1 and S2 i recommend. Pretty hilarous. romance here and there but mostly hilarious and stupid as the name implies (baka=stupid)

Daily Life of High School Boys: Really good. The plot starts off slow but progresses really great throughout. ITs main strongpoint is when they keep adding characters in the series and its funny as it mocks some daily life. They even make the ending a joke (you'll see)

SAO S1 was great, tho only thing which they could've toned down was the Kirito-Asuna 24/7 ever since episode 10
